Package by.it.academy.dodo.controllers

Class WorkScheduleController

java.lang.Object
by.it.academy.dodo.controllers.WorkScheduleController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/v1") public class WorkScheduleController extends Object
The `WorkSchedule` class provides RESTful endpoints for managing work-schedule-related operations.

Endpoints:

  • POST /api/v1/worker/{id}/workSchedule - Create a new work schedule by worker ID.
  • GET /api/v1/workSchedule/{startWork}/{endWork} - Retrieve the work schedule of a worker for a specific week.
  • GET /api/v1/workSchedule/{dateWork}- Retrieve the work schedule of a worker for a specific day.
  • DELETE /api/v1/workSchedule/{id} - Delete work schedule by ID.

Each method in this class corresponds to a specific API endpoint and delegates the processing to the underlying WorkScheduleService for business logic.

This class is annotated with `@RestController`, indicating that it handles HTTP requests and returns the response directly instead of relying on a view resolver.

The `@RequestMapping` annotation is used to specify the base URL for all endpoints defined in this class ("/api/v1"). This helps organize and group related endpoints under a common base path.

The `@RequiredArgsConstructor` annotation is used to generate a constructor with required fields, in this case, injecting an instance of WorkScheduleService.

  • Method Details

    • create

      @PostMapping("worker/{id}/workSchedule") public boolean create(@PathVariable UUID id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid WorkScheduleRequestDTO workScheduleRequestDTO)
      Create a new work schedule by worker ID.
      Parameters:
      id - Worker's ID.
      workScheduleRequestDTO - The work schedule data to be created.
      Returns:
      `true` if the work schedule is successfully created. In case of an error, returns error message.

    • getDayWorkSchedule

      @GetMapping("workSchedule/{dateWork}") public List<WorkScheduleResponseDTO> getDayWorkSchedule(@PathVariable LocalDate dateWork)
      Retrieve the work schedule of a worker for a specific day.
      Parameters:
      dateWork - The date for which the work schedule is requested.
      Returns:
      A list of WorkScheduleResponseDTO objects representing the day's work schedule.

    • getWeekWorkSchedule

      @GetMapping("workSchedule/{startWork}/{endWork}") public List<WorkScheduleResponseDTO> getWeekWorkSchedule(@PathVariable LocalDate startWork, @PathVariable LocalDate endWork)
      Retrieve the work schedule of a worker for a specific week.
      Parameters:
      startWork - Start date of the week.
      endWork - End date of the week.
      Returns:
      List of WorkScheduleResponseDTO responses for the specified week

    • delete

      @DeleteMapping("workSchedule/{id}") public boolean delete(@PathVariable UUID id)
      Delete work schedule by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - Work schedule's ID.
      Returns:
      `true` if the work schedule is successfully created. In case of an error, returns error message.
